intro: Huperzia hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's clubmoss, is a rare and ancient vascular plant belonging to the family Huperziaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and distinctive, clustered growth habit. The plant produces sporangia on specialized structures called strobila, which are typically found at the tips of its branches. Huperzia hohenackeri thrives in shaded, moist environments, often in temperate forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
